-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                              General Information
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Type.................: Game		|
Platform.............: Windows   	|
Crack................: Included	- STEAM	|
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Vampire: The Masquerade: Bloodlines, abbreviated as Bloodlines or VTMB, is a 
computer role-playing game for Windows developed by Troika Games in 2004. Like 
Activision's Vampire: The Masquerade: Redemption, Bloodlines is set in White 
Wolf, Inc.'s Vampire: The Masquerade universe, but it is not a sequel to the 
earlier game. The game allows the player to choose one of several different 
vampire clans and progress through the game according to the different 
strengths and weaknesses of the player's character, as in its paper and pencil 
role playing origins.

Bloodlines is notable for being the first game along with Half-Life 2 to use 
Valve's Source engine, which allows the game to be played from either the 
first-person or third-person shooter perspective. There were many technical 
and playability bugs in the first version of Bloodlines, but none were judged to 
be serious enough to delay shipping the game. After Bloodlines was released to 
the public, Activision compiled a list of problems customers were reporting to 
its customer service department and on various Vampire websites. It then 
authorized Troika to spend a week creating a patch to address the most serious 
issues. However, Troika's inability to find revenue from another project had 
already forced the developer to lay off all its employees in two waves, except 
for the three owners: Jason Anderson, Leonard Boyarsky and Tim Cain. Despite 
this, several employees continued to work without pay on the Version 1.2 patch, 
which after three weeks was released on December 22, 2004.

Unable to find additional work, Troika disestablished in February 2005,leaving 
behind an essentially unfinished game with numerous remaining bugs. Fans of 
Bloodlines continued to create and release unofficial patches to address this 
situation.

This is a new Release of Vampire The Masquerade: Bloodlines. While the original 
release and many other releases did contain all the necessary files for a clean 
install of Vampire The Masquerade: Bloodlines, they were flawed by Vista 
installation problems, stability issues, initialization problems, and poor 
documentation. By converting the content to a DVD format with a single 
installer, providing an autopatching system (to unofficial version 6.0) and 
better documentation these issues have been resolved. Vampire The Masquerade: 
Bloodlines, is one of the best RPG's to come into existence and is a tribute 
to the unpaid work of its former developers at Troika.

This release is intended to provide accessibility to those individuals who found 
difficulty in utilizing the Federation's original Vampire: The Masquerade - 
Bloodlines releases. It is amazingly stable (M001 guarentees it), and has 
worked flawelessly through a complex battery of tests, including over twenty
unique system installations. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                              Miscellaneous Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please Note The Following:

.I.
The Federation takes no responsibility for any damage that may come to your 
computer through the trial of this game. This mod has been tested to work 
on Windows XP and Vista. No support or technical assistance will be provided. 
Ever. Creation of this release took many hours of unpaid labour. 
.II.
The stability of the game only exists thanks to the tireless efforts of the 
Jason Anderson, Leonard Boyarsky and Tim Cain who in conjunction with the 
aforementioned unpaid Troika employees created the final official patch. 
None of the aforementioned individuals support or piracy. The Federation 
released their work without their permission.
.III.
The Unofficial Patch dissasembled and used in the Federation Autopatching
system was made by Dan Upright and then continued by Werner "Wesp5" Spahl 
and members of the Planet Vampire community. Neither Dan Upright, Werner Spahl, 
or the Planet Vampire community support or condone piracy. The Federation 
released their work without their permission. 
.III.
To all the Fans, Friends, Foes, Members and Affiliates, of the FEDERATION:

			-----------------------
			|THANKS FOR EVERYTHING| 
                        -----------------------

Because of you we are "STILL UNDERGROUND" and "STILL ALIVE".
[54686f73652057686f204b6e6f772055732043616e2046696e64205573]

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Install Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Steps:

(1.) Extract the "Vampire - The Masquerade Bloodlines.rar" file to a directory 
of your choice and then Navigate to the extracted directory. Mount or burn the 
image in the aforementioned directory. 

(2.) Explore the image and run the "AUTORUNVAMPIRE.EXE" binary/executable. The
wrapper program will then install the game, update itself, and remove the disk 
check (click through both sets of installation steps).

Note: 
The image must be installed to the one of the potential default directories
These directories are:
[C:Program FilesActivisionVampire - Bloodlines]
[D:Program FilesActivisionVampire - Bloodlines]
[E:Program FilesActivisionVampire - Bloodlines]
[F:Program FilesActivisionVampire - Bloodlines]

(3.) Double click on the desired shortcut located by default on the desktop.

"Vampire - The Masquerade: Bloodlines - Fullscreen" - Vampire Gameplay[NEW SYSTEMS]
"Vampire - The Masquerade: Bloodlines - Window"     - Vampire Gameplay[NEW SYSTEMS]
"Vampire - The Masquerade: Bloodlines - Archaic"    - Vampire gameplay[OLD SYSTEMS]

Note: The official manual, soundtrack, and game covers are included in the 
".Extras" directory.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                  Known Problems
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
(1.) False Positive - The users anti-virus client may detect this programs as a 
Virus or Trojan. This false positive is caused by the binary wrapped scripts 
which are utilized as launchers for the games. As these files create hidden 
functionality they appear as threatening to the overzealous virus scanner eSafe.
Detailed scans have/will indicate that this release neither accesses key system 
files or the internet. There is no way for these files to harm your computer.

(2.) NTDLL Error - The user may experience a crash related to an unspecified
NTDLL error if he/she is using an old or archaic computer. This can be resolved
by double clicking on the "Vampire - The Masquerade: Bloodlines - Archaic"
shortcut, set by default on the users desktop.
